dmca.title: Notification of Website Infringement
dmca.body:
-----Original Message-----
From: Ryan, Dan [mailto:Dan.Ryan@BakerNet.com] 
Sent: Thursday, March 24, 2005 1:31 AM
To: legal-response@theplanet.com
Cc: Simone, Joseph; Pond, Albert
Subject: Re: Notification of Website Infringement 
Importance: High

Dear Sir, 

We write on behalf of our client, Intel Corporation.

Our client is the exclusive owner of the internationally registered INTEL
trademark and is the registrant of the domain name
www.intel.com<http://www.intel.com/>.> 

It has come to our client's attention that your company is the Internet
Service Provider for www.intel-mail.com. The name of this website as well as
its contents are misleading to the user as it may lead them to draw the
conclusion that the website is an official site managed by Intel or that
Intel is in some way associated with or endorses this website.  The website
is also using unauthorized pictures of our client' s products and/or
advertising campaigns. Such use of the Intel Trademarks was made without our
client's prior consent and constitutes infringement of Intel's intellectual
property rights.  

This same operator registered the website www.windows-mail.com which we took
successful action against. The relevant UDRP decision is attached for your
reference. 

Our argument is based within the scope of your > "> Acceptable Use Policy>
">  set forth in http://www.theplanet.com/legal/aup.html> of your
registration agreement, it specifies that the Policy is applicable to the
Disputed Domain Name.

Accordingly, we kindly request you to :-

1. immediately terminate or suspense the services www.intel-mail.com
receives from your company; and

2. remove all web page content in relation to the unlawful use of the Intel
Trademarks, all hyperlinks to and from www.intel-mail.com.  

We hope that you would be able to comply with the above and maintain the
good use of the Internet by your clients.  Again, we appreciate your
co-operation in this matter and we look forward to hearing back.

If you have any questions with regard to the contents of this letter, please
contact our Mr. Dan Ryan (Tel: +852 2846 2412; email:
dan.ryan@bakernet.com).


 <<Decision-window-mail.com.PDF>> 


Yours faithfully,
Baker & McKenzie 




Dan Ryan
Registered Foreign Lawyer
Baker & McKenzie
14th Floor,  Hutchison House
10 Harcourt Road
Hong Kong SAR
Direct line: +852 2846 2412 
Fax: +852 2845 0476
Email: dan.ryan@bakernet.com

> This e-mail is from the Hong Kong office of Baker & McKenzie, which is a
member of Baker & McKenzie International, a Swiss Verein. A list of the
partners can be provided upon request. The Hong Kong office is regulated by
the Law Society of Hong Kong. This e-mail may contain privileged and
confidential information. It is intended for the named recipient(s) only. If
you are not an intended recipient, please notify us immediately (by reply
e-mail) and delete this e-mail from your system. We use third-party service
providers to filter unsolicited promotional e-mails ("SPAM") and provide
other technical support for our electronic communications. All such third
parties are required to implement appropriate security measures to protect
our electronic data. Such filtering could result in deletion of a legitimate
e-mail before it is read by its intended recipient at our firm, although the
risk of this is minimised by our reviewing the filtered messages regularly.
Please contact us if you have any queries about this automatic filtering.
> 
>
